alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Houston; Polk; Trinity; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 9:37AM CDT until March 28 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Texas... Neches River Near Diboll affecting Tyler, Houston, Angelina, Polk and Trinity Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following river in Texas... Neches River Near Neches affecting Cherokee, Houston and Anderson Counties. For the Neches River...including Diboll...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River Near Diboll, Texas. * WHEN...From this Saturday evening to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs. Expect flooded boat ramps and trails. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this Saturday evening to a crest of 12.1 feet during the wee hours of Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued this morning at 1045 AM CDT.
